snippet: Official news accounts said the assailants, armed with bombs made from gas cylinders, attacked the police in the ethnically divided Xinjiang region.
abstract: Police in Xinjiang, ethnically divided region in far western China, fatally shoot eight people after what the state-run news media describes as an attack by assailants armed with bombs made from gas cylinders; bombers were Uighurs.

byline.contributor: Bree Feng contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Official news accounts said the assailants, armed with bombs made from gas cylinders, attacked the police in the ethnically divided Xinjiang region.

headline.main: Police Fatally Shoot 8 After What China Calls a Terrorist Attack
headline.print_headline: Police Fatally Shoot 8 After What China Calls a Terrorist Attack
